hint.text: First, find the LCM of the three numbers. Then, resolve the LCM as a product of its prime factors and make pairs of similar factors.

solution.text:
\(15=3 \times 5\)
\(18=3 \times 3 \times 2\)
\(20=2 \times 2 \times 5\)
LCM of \(15, 18, 20\) is \(2 \times 2 \times 3 \times 3 \times 5 = 180\)
Now, \(180=2 \times 2 \times 3 \times 3 \times 5\)
After pairing the similar factors, we observe that prime factor \('5'\) has no pair.
Multiplying the LCM by \(5; 180 \times 5 = 900. \)
\(900=2 \times 2 \times 3 \times 3 \times 5 \times 5\)
Notice that \(900\) is a perfect square of \(2 \times 3 \times 5 = 30\)
Therefore, the smallest square number that is divisible by each of the numbers \(15, 18\) and \(20\) is \(900\).
